definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Translation of Hugo all-roundly and systematically could embody Zengpu's translation standard best.
sentences.chinese: 对雨果的全面系统译介最好地体现了曾朴的翻译标准。

sentences.english: One day, Hugo heard that her father and brothers were away.
sentences.chinese: 一天，雨果听说她的父兄几人都出门往了。

sentences.english: You can kvetch all you want about Hugo SAYING that he considers Gaddafi a friend.
sentences.chinese: 你可以大骂雨果查韦斯称视卡扎菲为友。

sentences.english: Hugos friends fetched their horses and followed him.
sentences.chinese: 雨果的朋友们找到了自己的马匹，跟着他追去了。

sentences.english: Hugo found the thought in crack in the rock, and I found the wind in the treetops.
sentences.chinese: 雨果在石头缝里找到了思想，而我在树梢间寻到了风。

sentences.english: This devil of a man had something to do with Mr. Hugo.
sentences.chinese: 那个恶魔般的男人和雨果先生还有点关系。

sentences.english: "Notre-Dame De Paris" is representative works of Victor Hugo .
sentences.chinese: 《巴黎圣母院》是雨果的代表作品之一。

sentences.english: Mr. Hugo didn’t look up from his plate.
sentences.chinese: 雨果先生没有从自己的盘子上抬起头来。

sentences.english: Quatre_Vingt_Treize is an unusual and prominent novel written by Victor Hugo.
sentences.chinese: 《九三年》是雨果一部特殊且重要的小说。

sentences.english: Hugo - with three nominations in all - is in the running for best drama picture.
sentences.chinese: 《雨果》获得三项提名，将角逐最佳剧情类电影。

sentences.english: Her win comes a year after Liu Cixin won a Hugo for his novel The Three-Body Problem.
sentences.chinese: 就在一年前，刘慈欣的作品《三体》获得了雨果奖。

sentences.english: Mr. Hugo wasn’t suspicious at all.
sentences.chinese: 雨果先生丝毫没有起疑心。

definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
Guy de Maupassant (1850-1893), French novelist and short story writer
Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer
William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Ernest Hemingway (1899-1961), American novelist and journalist
Cervantes/abbr. for 米格爾·德·塞萬提斯·薩維德拉|米格尔·德·塞万提斯·萨维德拉[Mi3 ge2 er3 · de2 · Sai1 wan4 ti2 si1 · Sa4 wei2 de2 la1]
